msItem.title: [Excerpta diversa de rebus astronomicis et e poetis]
msItem.note: Excerpts from the 'Ex Bedae Computo', Pliny, Nonius Marcellinus, Vergil

support.material: Parchment, with paper flyleaves and leather and wood binding

layoutDesc.layout: Single column, usually 24 lines per page, but 26 lines per page ff. 107-178. Written area 155 x 80–105 mm [Leonardi/Bischoff]

handDesc.p: By multiple St Gall hands, perhaps 3 for the main texts. Poems sometimes in rustics, in red or black. Titles in large rustics and large red monumental capitals. Initials in red, yellow and green. Many illustrations such as the ornamented figure on 119r. Space left blank for (unrealised) images in the Prudentius (e.g. 189v), though we see sketches on 195r-v. Numerous glosses both contemporary and later, both Latin and OH German, and neumes. Many other additions, including: two lines by a south-Frankish (?) hand on 207v; 106r (s. X/XI); 233r-v (s. X); 235v (s. X). Pen trials (s. X) on 236r. [Bischoff/Leonardi/Arnese]

additions.p: Brownish-black ink. Dry point ruling. The first page of every quire is hair-side, and within the quires the pages of the flesh-side are always one against the other, and likewise for the hair-side. Recent numbering in arabic numerals. Nineteenth-century binding in red leather and boards. Many ownership marks from St Gall: 1r, 104r, 206v. Uncertain as to when the manuscript arrived in Naples; earliest modern bibliographical references appear in the 1930s. May appear in the 1461 catalogue of St Gall: 'H 11 Boecius in pluribus et Prudencius' (Lehmann, MBKDS, p. 111.19) [Arnese/Bischoff/Leonardi/RMP]

origin.origDate: s. IX ⁴∕₄ and s. IX/X [Bischoff]
